labels.analysis: The MCP Server "Crypto Price & Market Analysis 123" primarily focuses on providing real-time and historical data about cryptocurrency markets. Its core functionality revolves around tracking prices, analyzing market trends, and offering market insights. The server is designed to help users stay informed about the cryptocurrency market by fetching current prices, historical data, and detailed analysis of exchanges and trading volumes.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" was chosen because the server's tools are specifically designed for tracking and analyzing cryptocurrency markets, which is a core aspect of this category. Secondary labels "Data Analysis & Processing" and "Financial Services" were added because the server provides analytical tools for processing cryptocurrency data and falls under the broader financial data category. No custom label is needed as the functionality is well-covered by predefined categories.

tools.name: get-crypto-price
tools.description: Get current price and 24h stats for a cryptocurrency

tools.name: get-market-analysis
tools.description: Get detailed market analysis including top exchanges and volume distribution

tools.description: Get historical price analysis with customizable timeframe

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@roman0211/mcp-crypto-price/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
